questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'docile'?
questions.explanation: Docile means easily taught or managed; 'defiant' emphasizes resisting control.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'eloquent'?
questions.explanation: Eloquent means fluent and persuasive in speaking; 'inarticulate' means unable to express oneself clearly.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'scrupulous'?
questions.explanation: Scrupulous means very honest and careful about doing what is right; 'dishonest' is the moral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'resolute'?
questions.explanation: Resolute means firmly determined; 'indecisive' means unable to make decisions.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'innocuous'?
questions.explanation: Innocuous means harmless; 'harmful' is the direct antonym.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'parsimonious'?
questions.explanation: Parsimonious means extremely unwilling to spend; 'generous' is the moral/behavioral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'austere'?
questions.explanation: Austere can mean plain and without decoration; 'ornate' means highly decorated.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'magnanimous'?
questions.explanation: Magnanimous means generous and forgiving; 'petty' is small-minded and ungenerous.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'volatile'?
questions.explanation: Volatile means likely to change suddenly; 'stable' means not easily changed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'gregarious'?
questions.explanation: Gregarious means enjoying the company of others; 'solitary' means preferring to be alone.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'copious'?
questions.explanation: Copious means abundant; 'sparse' means thinly spread or few in number.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'capricious'?
questions.explanation: Capricious means unpredictable and changeable; 'predictable' is the core opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'didactic'?
questions.explanation: Didactic means intended to teach; 'noneducational' means not designed for teaching.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'loquacious'?
questions.explanation: Loquacious means very talkative; 'taciturn' means habitually silent or uncommunicative.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'stringent'?
questions.explanation: Stringent means very strict; 'lenient' means not strict or merciful.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'urbane'?
questions.explanation: Urbane means sophisticated and polished; 'uncouth' means lacking refinement or grace.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'concise'?
questions.explanation: Concise means brief; 'verbose' means using more words than necessary.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'placate'?
questions.explanation: Placate means to calm; 'provoke' means to stir up or anger.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'prolific'?
questions.explanation: Prolific means highly productive; 'unproductive' is the operational opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'staid'?
questions.explanation: Staid means serious and unadventurous; 'lively' means full of energy and excitement.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tacit'?
questions.explanation: Tacit means understood without being stated; 'explicit' means stated clearly in detail.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'reticent'?
questions.explanation: Reticent means reserved or not revealing one's thoughts; 'talkative' is the behavioral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'placid'?
questions.explanation: Placid means calm and peaceful; 'turbulent' suggests chaos and disturbance.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'congenial'?
questions.explanation: Congenial means pleasant and friendly; 'unfriendly' is the straightforward opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'buoyant'?
questions.explanation: Buoyant means cheerful and optimistic; 'depressed' is emotionally opposite.
